Connection to external database
The system allows configuring connections to external databases.
To get connected to an external database, the
JDBC interaction standard
is used.
The system supports interaction with the following databases: POSTGRESQL, MSSQL, ORACLE, SYBASE, MYSQL.
The connection to an external database can be used for configuring:
Primitive table object
;
ETL. Data source. External DB;
ETL. Data transformer. Running SQL query;
SQL Editor.
Configuring the connection to external database
To get connected to an external database, access (account credentials) is required.
To configure the connection to an external database, the user needs to create an instance of the "ETL. Connection to external database" configuration type.
The following settings should be specified for the configuration type:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Configuration name (can be generated automatically).
Server
The connection URL, containing:
network protocol, such as:
jdbc:oracle:thin
jdbc:sqlserver
jdbc:postgresql
address;
port;
URL path (for example, in PostgreSQL, a specific database for connection can be specified).
For example,
jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/my_db
The parameter value is specified by creating an instance of the "Secret variable" type.
Username
The username used to connect to the database.
Secret password
The account password used to connect to the database.
The parameter value is specified by creating an instance of the "Secret variable" type.
Scheme
The database scheme to connect to.
This setting is optional.
After filling in all fields, the user needs to save the configuration.
